result.execSummary:
The defendant Michelle L Hess was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court costs/fees and DNA surcharge is Waived
.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with probation in La Crosse Co case 15CF159, with conditions also concurrent
.

miscConds.notes:
Obtain GED or HSED

Obtain and maintain employment
.

Def to undergo Alcohol and Drug Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations.
.

Def is not to consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances without a prescription from licensed physician, with random testing

No Contact with users or traffickers of illicit drugs or controlled substances

No Contact with K.L. or Christhaven Group Home
.

Def to obtain her Driver's License

Pay DOC Supervision fees

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of resititution victims and/or govermental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michelle L Hess
